Title: Building Confident Systems: Distributed , Resilient and Non-Blocking Systems.
Description: This session covers techniques involved in building scalable, available systems on the web, I will be highlighting areas on asynchronous processing , event-driven architecture, and message queuing as regards to the downsides when these components are not in place and possible benchmarks, this will be accompanied with diagrams(level architecture) of how a case study could be treated as so.

Title: Developer Experience - A Catalyst for Success
Description: Developer Experience is a key part of any B2D product, it is often neglected, and other times it is not. The quality of your product's developer experience will be responsible for your customer retention rate. In this talk, we'll be discussing what developer experience is, why and how to pay attention to your developer experience and we'll explore products with great developer experience.

Title: Neuromarketing and Community Management: The Science of Consumers/Users Decisions
Description:
A talk on how employing neuromarketing in managing users and community members gives you success.
As Humans, we move between - the desire for new things and at the same time, the fear of the unknown.
Neuromarketing is essential to study how to appeal to users and consumers' emotions, to get them to take actions. 

Using neuromarketing in integrated marketing is an ingredient for all-time success!

Title: Legal for Tech Talents: Protecting your Intellectual Property Rights like a Pro
Description: This session aims to teach tech talents on the elements of an employment contract, the red flags to look out for, how to negotiate favourable terms for themselves and most importantly what to know about their intellectual property developed in the course of employment and how to protect these rights. This session will allow for questions and answers and real life scenarios referenced.

Title: UX and Product Localization
Description: The Nigerian and African tech scene is growing rapidly as new startups and products are expanding into new markets across the continent. While expanding into new markets is both exciting and filled with some uncertainties, in this session I will be talking about how best to adapt UX and products to fit the culture and behaviour of new markets for the best business growth and customer experience.

Title: Secured!! More than just coding.
Description:
While the emergence of technology spells a lot of good for humanity, we would be ignorant also to ignore the bad, with a rise in technology and tech bros, security is becoming more important. Cybercrime will increase just as tech does. How do we solve this problem? We educate!! 

I propose a session that equips developers with the mindset of secure coding. It is not all about writing code.

Title: Make time count with Wear OS
Description:
This talk will teach you about building Wear OS applications with Compose and Material Design. I will discuss my process of creating a countdown application with Jetpack Compose, Tiles and the Horologist APIs. You will also learn how to test your application on a Wear emulator.

You will leave this talk ready to (re)build your Wear OS applications with Jetpack Compose and Material Design.

Title: Supercharged with Firebase
Description: Supercharge your software development process with Firebase, gain insights driven by data to help make decisions about your product which can accelerate growth.

Title: Technical Writing: The good, the bad, the ugly
Description:
This talk will highlight my journey so far, looking at the good, the bad, and the ugly sides of our journeys. 

It took me over 5 years and learning to write over 5 languages to realize that writing was my thing. And even as confident in my writing as I am, I have faced rejections too. 

In summary, I want everyone, especially the newbies and curious minds, to know that "All of us dey collect.

Title: Building for Large Screens in Android - A journey!
Description: Besides having a functional mobile application, the overall screen design should be efficient and easy to use. In this session, we will do a deep dive on why we should pay attention to large screens in Android development. We will discuss some of the pain points we face as developers and then illustrate how to implement then test using design guidelines for large screens.

Title: Deploy and scale your containerized app on Google Cloud.
Description: Choosing the right service to run your containerized workload requires several considerations such as the type of workload being deployed. This talk will walk the audience through the decision-making process of choosing the right GCP service to run their containerized workload. We will also demonstrate how to configure your app to take advantage of built-in scalability options for each service.

Title: You are as just secure as your software supply chain security
Description: In the GitLab 2022 DevSecOps Survey, 43% shared their organizations are unprepared for security incidents. There is no shortage of tools promising to secure different parts of the software development lifecycle. But there needs to be a trusted supply chain security standard, one of which is the Supply chain Levels for Software Artifacts, or SLSA. Abubakar will talk about the SLSA framework.

Title: Considerations for Deploying ML Models on Edge Devices
Description: What do you need to keep in mind when training ML models that will be deployed on constrained devices such as phones, Raspberry Pis, or even Arduinos? This session goes into the considerations and the code. snippets required for these.

Title: Supercharging Navigator 1.0 In Your Mobile App - Flutter
Description:
With the introduction of navigation 2.0 in flutter, there's been a lot of hype around it and the problem it solves.

This talk aims at informing the audience of the merits of navigation 1.0, how it solves their routing problems on mobile apps and how to give your navigation superpowers. You dont exactly need navigation 2.0 if your target is mobile apps only.

Title: A Guide to Product Experimentation
Description: This talk will focus on the how-to of product experimentation. Topics will include: Understanding the problem statement, defining the goals and non-goals, outlining the solution and alternatives, defining the success metrics and launch criteria, and making decisions based on experiments.

Title: The Developer to Developer Relations Arc: How developers can find their voices in the workplace
Description:
How developers can find the right nexus between core functionality work and helping other developers find success in using the product. 

Exploring the mediums available to getting started with developer relations as a developer, and getting traction and recognition for work already done. 

How every developer can tap into a dev rel mindset for visibility and success in the workplace.
